relation: Great for these types of students
Students who are looking for a friendly, homey atmosphere and who want to have a lot of FUN
Totally worth every penny you will spend to go here
Movies, go to Green River Lake, play sports, go to the Student Activity Center, go to town for shopping
The food isn't terrible, but it could be better. Steak Night is probably my favorite meal in the Caf :)

I absolutely LOVE the girls who live on my dorm hall. We're like a big family, and we always have a good time together! It can be annoying having to share space with a roommate, but for the most part it's awesome.

The classes I have taken at Campbellsville so far have been challenging at times but easy at others. There has only been one class so far that has been more challenging than the others, but it's not more than I can handle.

Make sure you reach all the deadlines on time for scholarships, enrollment, and housing information, etc. And don't be discouraged if you don't get a certain scholarship-there are TONS of scholarships to apply for at CU-they even give you a scholarship just for being a good student!

I absolutely love being a student at CU. I knew from the moment I first stepped foot on campus that I was going to spend the next four years of my life here. Everyone is so friendly...you will have tons of friends in less than a week!
pageTitle: Campbellsville University Reviews: Student Reviews and Ratings | Cappex
textBeforeTable: 12/13/2010 Reviewer is A current student here. 7 out of 8 people found this review useful. 1 person found this inaccurate. 1 of 27 Michaela from Oak Grove, KY Check out reviews left by other students or leave your own review. textAfterTable: Great for these types of students -Punctual -Ready to learn -Wants to be at the school Tips for prospective students -If you plan on skipping class for no reason, the attendance policy will make your life miserable. -Academics is rated very high for this school. So plan on working hard in the majority of your classes. Bang for the buck Campbellsville, has recently become quite expensive. So if you haven't applied for any scholarships, do so. The Internet has many options available to you. Am enjoying being here I enjoy going to my education major classes. Some of the professors, and students tend to be snobby and put off. Am learning a lot When a person is taking courses in their intended major, they will definitely learn lots. However, in the gen ed courses, it will all depend on the professor if the student will gain the knowledge intended.
